item.title: The Beauty of Python
item.description: Python is a very popular coding language. The language itself is dynamically typed and runs at a high level, making the syntax simple and the language easy to learn. The very first thing I learned in Python was how to print to the console output. This was very first line of Python I wrote: print("Hello World!") ## Hello World! I self-learned python in high school for the purpose of machine learning in order to make March Madness predictions and help me make decisions on which basketball players to start for daily fantasy games.

item.title: Project 1: Exploratory Data Analysis on March Madness Predictions
item.description: ## paste this chunk into the ```{r setup} chunk at the top of your project 1 .Rmd file knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, eval = TRUE, fig.align = "center", warning = F, message = F, tidy=TRUE, tidy.opts=list(width.cutoff=60), R.options=list(max.print=100)) Introduction As an avid basketball fan and with March Madness fully underway, I wanted to do a project exploring predictors for success in the tournament. I found datasets from two different websites. The first dataset I found came from Kaggle and it featured many advanced statistics of college teams as well as how they fared in the NCAA tournament along with their tournament ranking.

item.title: Project 2: Modeling, Testing, and Predicting
item.description: Qinglong Yang qy929 Introduction The dataset used for this project was retreived from vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/datasets.html. It includes 1174 observations and contains variables that are possibly linked to violent crime rates. These variables include violent (the violent crime rate), murder (the murder rate), prisoners (the number of incarcerated), afam (percent of state population that is African-American, ages 10 to 64), cauc (percent of state population that is Caucasian, ages 10 to 64), male (the percent of the states population that is a male between the ages of 10 to 29), income (the real per capita income), and law (whether or not the state has a gun carry law).

item.title: Projects
item.description: Check out some of my coding projects below: Wrangling & Exploratory Data Analysis Modeling, Inference, Prediction --
